reviews.text: Excellent location for exploring ancient Rome. Walked everywhere including to great restaurants. Biggest asset is the friendly helpful staff who treated me like a friend visiting from abroad. While not a luxury hotel it is excellent value for a trip where most of the time is spent sightseeing. I look forward to staying there again.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent a long weekend at the Hotel Giuliana in Rome recently, and found it was a lovely small hotel, with tidy clean rooms. The staff were friendly and welcoming and always available to help you with any matters. The breakfast was basic,but fresh and tasty. Overall, we had a very nice time and found this a good safe spot to explore Rome. I would not hesitate to recommend this to friends and family.
reviews.title: Great Room in Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at the Hotel Giuliana for five days at the end of Jan 2009. It is situated about eight minutes walk from either metro line and about ten minutes walk from the main historical sites such as the Colesseum. It is situated on a quiet back street. We booked and paid for a standard room but were given a larger superior room on arrival as it was quiet (we didn't ask for this and were charged the lower price for a standard room). It was immaculately clean with useful facilities such as tea/coffee making facilities, a programmable safe in the wall, a wall-mounted hair dryer, TV and bath & shower. The towels and linen were changed regularly and the room cleaned every day. The hotel is maintained to a very high standard and rooms were being renovated during our stay, although it appeared to be painting etc which didn't disturb us in terms of noise.
reviews.title: A friendly home from home

reviews.text: The hotel is run by a family, and at least one of them was present every day. They were most anxious that we were happy with everything and were more than helpful in terms of suggesting places to visit and local restaurants to go to. They were very happy to chat and answer all our questions about local life and customs. It was very good value for the location, standard of service and facilities. The personal attention in this small family-run hotel is what sets it apart from more commercial and larger hotels. We would definitely recommend it to friends and family and would definitely return ourselves.
reviews.title: Unpleasant experience
Satisfying Experience at Hotel Giuliana
reviews.text: We arrived at the Giuliana before check in time and were pleased to be checked into our room straight away. We were slightly taken aback by a nasty smell but we opened the windows, unpacked and went out for the afternoon. The room was very small but nice and clean and the bathroom looked lovely, it just couldn't be entered due to the absolutely foul smell.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you Antonio and Marianna for a wonderful stay in Rome. Your personal service was exceptional as were the made to order breakfast cappuccinos . Thank you for your assistance in locating fabulous restaurants, aquiring transportation and learning about all Rome has to offer. We will certainly recommend your pleasant hotel to friends.
reviews.title: Personal Service at Hotel Giuliana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the first place in Italy that we stayed at and as an introductory hotel it was ok. (It turns out our rooms got better and better as we moved around.) The room was simple, clean, functional w convenient mini-fridge and necessary room safe. The shower did have warm water but it had water pressure challenges. The room did have air which we did use initially, but found that we could leave the window open (and shutters closed) in the evening to make it more comfortable. We did have to contend with a few flying bugs which did bite us. The window opened to the side alley / road which would set up for flea market every morning (except Sun.) at 6 AM. So, if you didn't want to get up early, you're best keeping the window closed. The neighbourhood otherwise was pretty quiet at night.
reviews.title: Good location but not best value for $ in Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't meet the owners, but the staff they had at the desk around the clock were very friendly and helpful. The morning we left to catch an early train, we searched out breakfast before it was typically available and we were gladly presented w a cappuccino and the rest of the typical cold breakfast fare.
reviews.title: Great Value in Rome

reviews.text: One thing that struck us was how they kept all their garbage and recycling at the main floor entrance (near the foot of the old fashioned open elevator). Coming and going and climbing/descending the stairs meant breathing thru your mouth to avoid the odours. Thankfully we weren't visiting in hot weather - I imagine it would be considerably worse in the summer.
reviews.title: Clean, friendly and in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the Giuliana as much as the other reviewers did. The room was small, but very clean with a really nice bathroom and no street noise to speak of. The staff was exceptionally helpful. The Termini Station is just a few mintues' walk to the hotel, so if you fly into Leonardo da Vinci airport and take the express train into the city, you can definitely walk to the hotel. There is also a Metro stop a few blocks away which was nice as it was our first time in Rome and this enabled us to get to and from attractions easily. There are some good restaurants in the neighborhood. We would definitely recommend the Giuliana--the value was excellent.
reviews.title: Great staff and location

reviews.text: If you are looking for a great priced Hotel with awsome staff and breakfast inclueded then this is he place too stay!! I strongly recomend Hotel Giuliana, as they go out of their way to make your stay as pleasant as possible!!
reviews.title: When in Rome stay at Hotel Giuliana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rome is an expensive city for hotels. Hotel Giuliana has nice rooms at a reasonable rate. But that does not begin to tell the story. What makes this hotel is the service. They went out of their way to be friendly, helpful, and make sure everything was fantastic.
reviews.title: Great Location, Fantastic Staff, Pretty Good Rooms

reviews.text: Big Pluses:
reviews.title: Very friendly staff

reviews.text: Location - Close enough to the train station, but not too close to the seediness around Termini. We walked everywhere around Rome from here, 15 minutes to the Coliseum, 20 minutes to the Spanish Steps. We even took the Metro to St. Peter’s and walked back hitting Piazza Novana and the Pantheon. Not a bad walk at all. Even a small grocery store one block away for cheap water and other supplies.
reviews.title: Convenient if you like walking

reviews.text: Service – Like I said, best thing about the place. Great breakfast with friendly staff, arrainged a very nice taxi to take us to the airport. Recommended great local restaurants. Absolutely perfect.
reviews.title: Could not wait to go back for my second staying!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from 5 days in Rome and cannot fault the Hotel Giuliana. All the staff were very helpful, rooms were clean and well kept. Good breakfast each morning which was very much welcomed before exploring the city of foot.
reviews.title: Brilliant location and great value for money

reviews.text: Location wise the Giuliana is perfect, 10 min walking from Tremini and within walking distance of all major tourist sites. Great restaurants close buy and a good Irish pub showing live sport just round the corner.
reviews.title: Great Hotel & Staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all Giuliana ticks all the boxes for good value in a central location.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money
Great Staff, lovely room and central location
reviews.text: I wasnt reallyy expecting much as the price was so cheap but I was pleasantly suprised. The rooms were nice and clean decent size for European standards. The woman who is the owner I think was so nice and welcoming! It had a nice family feel to it. The location was great. Just around the corner to the train station where i got the hop on off bus tour. Quiet and safe as well. Nice places to eat around the hotel as well. Really enjoyed my stay and I will definately be going back there again!

reviews.title: Fantastic City
reviews.text: We booked this hotel based on the reviews on this site and were not disappointed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Giuliana was conveniently located for us arriving at Termini, but also close enough to walk to most to old city sights. The hotel staff were the most friendly we encountered during our 5 week holiday. The room was very clean, wifi worked well and was comparatively affordable. We would stay at Guiliana again. The best hotels are the ones that make your stay easy, and this is one of those.
reviews.title: Our stay at Giuliana was effortless, the way it should be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at Guiliana's on three separate occasions and each time have been warmly welcomed by the wonderful staff who, all of whom speak excellent English, and make you feel at home from the moment you step through the door of this 1st-floor hotel, just 5 to 10 minutes stroll from Termini station.
reviews.title: Wouldn't stay anywhere else - lovely staff, great little hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast, served by Marilyn, is a delightful way to begin the day.
reviews.title: A Perfect Fit

reviews.text: Guilana's offered us a very good rate in August for a good-sized double room. The bathroom, by Rome standards, was large and very well appointed.
reviews.title: Good for what I needed

reviews.text: We have recommended this hotel to other friends and relatives who enjoyed staying there just as much as we have done.
reviews.title: FANTASTICO

reviews.text: I stayed here with a friend for 3 nights and found the location of the hotel and the staff to be both excellent. I had chosen this hotel from previous reviews on Trip advisor and we were not disappointed. Staff were especially helpful and friendly. After touring around Italy we needed an extra night accommodation prior to flying out the next day and we chose to stay here again on our way home. We are 2 single ladies in our middle age who have not travelled much on our own and this hotel was an excellent choice for us. Thank you to Jean and staff.
reviews.title: Very Happy with Hotel Giuliana

reviews.text: used a 3 bed room. Its was very clean with fresh towles every day. The front desk staff all spoke perfect english and were very helpful and understanding. 10 min to most of rome highlights 20 min to spanish steps, you need to take transport to get to the vatican city with youngsters as its a very long walk otherwise. Used the local spar and coop stores for food and drinks which made the money go further.
reviews.title: A really Frendly Place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Many thanks to Jean, Federico,Antonio and all the wonderful staff at the Hotel Giuliana for making our first trip to Rome a wonderful experience! There are many reasons to stay at this hotel but the marvelous staff is THE main reason, they go above and beyond to meet or exceed your expectations. As for the other reasons, the location is very conveniently close to the Roma Termini train station. You can easily walk the 6 blocks and not bother with a taxi. It's also within easy walking distance of the Colosseum ( 1.5 Km.- around 20-30 minutes, depending on how much window shopping you do), Piazza Navona (2.2 Km-30 min.),the Spanish Steps ( 20 min.) and Piazza del Popolo ( 2.2 Km. - 30 min.).
reviews.title: 5 star service at a 2 star price

reviews.text: The rooms are very spacious and clean, with plenty of room for your suitcases. It is a juxtaposition of modern and antique: we loved the high ceilings and great wifi service!
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel, with Friendly and Helpful staff. A+++

reviews.text: We had a lovely, sparkling clean bathroom with a shower & tub- we did have hot water "issues" the first day, but these were quickly resolved by Jean and her staff.
reviews.title: the Best place to stay in Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 4 days in Rome in early March 09 at the Hotel Giuliana. Don't be put off by the large exterior door or the 1940's lift when you enter the ground floor hall.The hotel is situated on the 2nd floor and Jean the owner makes you feel welcome immediately. Our bedroom and bathroom were spotlessly clean, the double glazing did allow some traffic noise, and on the Saturday and Monday we heard the street traders setting up their stalls at 6 am ( with the windows, shutters and curtains closed ) . Breakfast was included in the price and was sufficient, no frills, tea/coffee toast ,cereal, juice, fruit /yogurt. Well positioned for sightseeing , good restaurants near hotel, don't pay 18 euro for a taxi from the train station, its a short 10 min walk. Overall ,would recommend, and would happily visit again.
reviews.title: Very clean ,well positioned small hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent a long weekend in Rome, and booked Giuliana on strength of previous reviews. Ignore the somewhat unprepossing street entrance, accommodation is first rate for the price. About 5 years ago on last trip to Rome I spent more on a so-called hotel with rooms you couldn't swing the proverbial cat in, Very handy location, close to Termini, Santa Maria Maggiore (for the hop on/off tour buses) and the bus routes on Via Nazionale. Friendly owners, whose restaurant suggestions were spot on. Only 2 mistakes - first was booking through one of the agencies; go direct to the hotel for best rates. Second was ignoring the advice re walking from Termini station and getting ripped off by a taxi.
reviews.title: Best value in Rome

reviews.text: We spent five nights in Hotel Giuliana in February and could not praise the owners and staff highly enough for their excellent service. This family-run hotel is very well located, easily accessible on foot from the train station and provides a perfect base from which to explore Rome. The hotel reception is manned 24hours a day and all guests ring the doorbell to enter, therefore it is very secure. Having said that, the area seems to be very safe anyway.
reviews.title: Excellent location, friendly service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were spotless and beds were comfortable. Breakfasts were very good, consisting of cereals, juice, croissants, toast, fruit and yoghurts.
reviews.title: great location, friendly staff

reviews.text: The service could not have been better. Jean and her daughter Marianna were extremely helpful and went out of their way to help us plan and book our activities.
reviews.title: Best Bargain in Rome

reviews.text: Great place, great people and service, excellent location, close to the station and most sites of interest, and easy for metro and bus use. Staff very helpfull and provides great tips for locations and restaurants. Rooms very clean, elevator to transport the luggage and good price for the rooms. We stayed for five nights. Only suggestion for improvement is to add some cheese and ham to cofee selection and extend wireless range to the rooms. Loved Rome and loved Giuliana!
reviews.title: great place

likes.disliked: — cofee with no cheese or ham and no internet acess in the room, only on public areas

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel Guiliana for three nights while in Rome. The hotel is wonderful. Very clean, comfortable beds, easy to find, within walking distance to everything. Close enough to train station but not too close. The staff was very welcoming and friendly. They suggested a wonderful restaurant to eat dinner at. I highly recommend this hotel while visiting Rome. Prices were very good for the quality.
reviews.title: Wonderful Gem in Rome

likes.liked: — Friendly people, location, overall experience was great.
likes.disliked: — The shower was rather small but served it purpose.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Giuliana was the first location for our honeymoon. The hospitality was wonderful. The staff went above and beyond their general duties to accomodate us. The rooms were always clean and the location was fantastic...we'd walk outside and around every corner was something on our list of landmarks to see. Without the lovely people at Hotel Giuliana, I'm sure our stay wouldn't have been as pleasant.
reviews.title: Just what we wanted.

likes.disliked: — The lack of internal facilities eg internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Average hotel; great location near the train station. Clean, quiet, room with very helpful staff and an inviting breakfast. Helped with arranging tour packages and offered locations for dining. All staff spoke fluent English.
reviews.title: average hotel, great location

likes.disliked: — Blah room with two twin, hard beds pushed together

reviews.text: Overall, pleasant stay and what we expected for two star accommodations.
reviews.title: incredible hospitality
